Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Oral Vinorelbine in Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy for Locally Advanced NSCLC

Trial_Design.evidence: A randomised controlled trial was conducted with participants recruited from multiple centers.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients aged 65 years or older with stage III NSCLC.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either oral vinorelbine with cisplatin and radiotherapy or standard cisplatin-based CCRT.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of oral vinorelbine in concurrent chemoradiotherapy (CCRT) for elderly patients with locally advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall response rate (ORR) measured at 3 months post-treatment.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applied to patients or clinicians, but outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention group and 100 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 98 participants in the intervention group and 97 in the control group using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The ORR was 54% in the intervention group compared to 37% in the control group (p = 0.02).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included grade 3 neutropenia in 9% of the intervention group and 4% in the control group.

Funding.evidence: Funding: This study was funded by the National Cancer Institute.
